metadata.title: CVE-2024-7592 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
There is a LOW severity vulnerability affecting CPython, specifically the'http.cookies' standard library module.When parsing cookies that contained backslashes for quoted characters inthe cookie value, the parser would use an algorithm with quadraticcomplexity, resulting in excess CPU resources being used while parsing thevalue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-7592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm10').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14').
